Restaurant details Description: Batch New Southern Kitchen & Tap is a modern casual dining restaurant & bar featuring a scratch-cooked, locally sourced new southern culinary menu and garden-to-glass cocktails. NCtravelz Raleigh, North Carolina 742 268 Reviewed 30 September 2019 via mobile Happy hour! We happened to arrive for dinner during happy hour and ended up at the bar instead. The happy hour deal is amazing and wasn't too crowded on a weekday. Three of us had the avocado toast, bacon tots (so good we ordered another), raw oysters, deviled eggs and mac and cheese (with brisket and fried chicken). We had a great time! Date of visit: July 2019 > > Ask NCtravelz about Batch New Southern Kitchen and Tap: West Palm Beach Thank NCtravelz This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. TheBatchTeam, Owner at Batch New Southern Kitchen and Tap: West Palm Beach, responded to this review Responded 24 January 2020 Thanks for your kind words, we're glad you all had such a nice time! Anytime you're back in Florida, you know where to find us :D Cheers, The Batch Team Report response as inappropriate Thank you. We appreciate your input. This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of Tripadvisor LLC Updating list... Read reviews in English Go back 80 - 84 of 100 reviews jazangel Boynton Beach, Florida 16 10 Reviewed 30 September 2019 via mobile Disappointing ambiance and service From the start we had a problem. They didn’t want to seat us until the whole party was here, even though the restaurant was nearly empty, although They did end up seating us. I had the batch breakfast. There was only one option for toast which contained seeds that I can’t eat. It came without butter or jelly or offer of any. The third cup of coffee (from the kitchen) wasn’t hot. No cream only milk. After awhile a DJ started playing. Music selections great but volume ridiculously loud making it difficult to converse with each other. Even after speaking to the manager there was no change. This was brunch not happy hour. The food was very good. Date of visit: September 2019 Ask jazangel about Batch New Southern Kitchen and Tap: West Palm Beach Thank jazangel This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. sfspearman 18 6 Reviewed 3 September 2019 A hidden gem of fantastic food Spent the last evening of my Palm Beach stay having dinner here, and my meal was delicious. Went with the Impossible Burger, and what made it was the B1 aioli that accompanied it. Yummy. For dessert, I ordered the Apple Crisp with house made Vanilla & Pecan ice cream- which I couldn't finish. The highlight of the meal was our server, Jay. He was possibly the kindest server I've had in recent memory. (I received some very bad news before we ordered, and I was teary throughout my visit). Without missing a beat or asking, Jay refilled my wine glass and let me cry, with the reason of "just because" he "thought I needed it". Waited after paying to speak to the manager about our experience- she (didn't get her name, unfortunately) seemed very happy that we chose Batch and had a good time. *I actually came in to try the Cathead Biscuits, but was too full after eating to order them! Date of visit: August 2019 Value Service Food Ask sfspearman about Batch New Southern Kitchen and Tap: West Palm Beach Thank sfspearman This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. matthewpC9153EV West Palm Beach, Florida 14 37 Reviewed 25 August 2019 via mobile Could be better... Heard great reviews so my wife and I decided to try it out for brunch on Sunday. Fairly busy but we were seated right away. Ten minutes later our server came to take drink order of a couple coffees and waters, 15 minutes later we received our drinks and then he was gone without letting us put our order in for another 15 minutes. Chicken and waffles were very very good as promised but it should not take 40 minutes to put in an order. Music selection was excellent but a tad too loud as we had to yell across the table to have a conversation. Will give it a few months and try again as food was good but not in a hurry to rush back. Date of visit: August 2019 Ask matthewpC9153EV about Batch New Southern Kitchen and Tap: West Palm Beach 2 Thank matthewpC9153EV This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. cairoamber Palm Beach Gardens, Florida 19 5 Reviewed 17 June 2019 via mobile Incredible Every single items we ordered was incredible. The ribs were delicious and the meat fell right off of the bone. The short rib burger has amazing flavor. I really enjoyed the toasted pecan whiskey sour. They grated fresh horseradish over the raw oysters. Incredible place! Date of visit: June 2019 Ask cairoamber about Batch New Southern Kitchen and Tap: West Palm Beach Thank cairoamber This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Privacy Terms & Conditions Terms of Use Overview Spaces Press Nearby Hotels Batch New Southern Kitchen and Tap: West Palm Beach Restaurant 223 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401, USA Batch New Southern Kitchen and Tap: West Palm Beach 223 Clematis St, West Palm Beach, FL 33401, USA Request Pricing Cuisine Type Southern/Soul # of Spaces 2 Capacity Max Seated: 225 We’re all about cookin’ from scratch. That means we avoid frozen products, we don’t cut corners, and we only feature the freshest and best ingredients we can source. We use local products, sustainable crops, and fair trade ingredients. It may take us a little more time and a little more work, but we were taught nothin’ worthwhile comes easy, and creating the best possible meal for you is all that matters. We are proud to cater to every diet- don’t be afraid to ask our servers for vegan and gluten-free options! We focus on craft American-made spirits, new-world wines, and Florida micro-brewed beers. 100% of our bitters, tinctures, and syrups are made in house. We feature freshly squeezed & cold-pressed juices, make our own sodas, use local fresh herbs, and even brandy our own domestic cherries. We believe all of our beverages should be made to the highest possible standard with the best possible ingredients and care, so each one of your drinks is something we’re proud to call ours.
